item.title: Suggested Init Script Before Coding in Golang
item.description: The very basic variable you need to lookout for in go is the environment variable $GOPATH. In Unix/Linux-based systems it is by default in ~/go. My preference is to put it in a directory where my go code exists. So here’s a short shell script I use: #!/bin/bash if [[ -z $GOPATH ]]; then export GOPATH=$(pwd) export PATH=$GOPATH/bin:$PATH echo '--------------------------------------------------------' echo 'GoLang environment now defined!' echo " GOPATH => $GOPATH" echo "Type 'exit' to remove the GoLang environment variables.
